place.name: LLANFEUGAN
place.gazetteerText: LLANVIGAN, or LLANFEUGAN, a parish in the district and county of Brecon; on the Brecon canal, near the river Usk, 2 miles NW of Talybont r. station, and 4 SE of Brecon. It contains the hamlets of Glynn-Collwn and Penkelly; and its Post town is Brecon. Acres, 12,642. Real property, £4,664. Pop., 674. Houses, 146. A castle of the Mortimers was here. Gileston was held by the Pierreponts. Some mining is carried on. The living is a rectory, united with the chapelry of Glynn, in the diocese of St. David's. Value, £580. * Patron, the Rev. John Price. The church is dedicated to St. Veugan. The churchyard contains a yew-tree about 29 feet in girth. Charities, £42. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
